data.title: The 81st Street Studio at the Met

data.text:
Explore hands-on stations where art and science meet at the Metâ€™s new free drop-in discovery and play space.

ğŸªµ Investigate the scientific properties of materials like wood, metal, and clay at interactive stations: create a drum and learn about sound; try digitally printing from a woodblock; play around with light using objects inspired by The Met collection.

ğŸ¶ Explore how material affects sound on an organ, castanet wall, marimba, wave boards, drum station, and guitars custom built by Yamaha.

ğŸ“• Browse a childrenâ€™s book collection designed to spark curiosity about materials and cultures around the world.

ğŸ“• Join free storytimes on weekend and Monday mornings.

â­ï¸ Pick up a free 81st Street Studio Family Field Guide to explore the Met galleriesâ€”and the world beyondâ€”with instructions that guide discovery and useful tools, a Look it Up reference booklet, and a field notebook for recording data and drawing conclusions. After your gallery adventure, collect stickers and earn a Met Field Scientist button.

ğŸ“± There may be wait during busy times, scan the QR code outside the studio to be added to the wait list.
